alert.note: Alert for Hennepin; Sherburne; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hennepin, east central Wright, west central Anoka and southeastern Sherburne Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rogers, or 18 miles east of Buffalo, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... St. Michael and Otsego around 425 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Elk River. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 10 in Minnesota between mile markers 209 and 217. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 159 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
